successStories.title: Success Stories
successStories.description: See how my mentoring helped other developers achieve their goals.

items.name: Felipe Carneiro
items.feedback: The mentoring helped me with the theoretical and practical basis of software development. Before, I studied independently, but with Lojhan's teaching, my learning and direction increased exponentially.

items.name: Fernando Lotti
items.feedback:
Man, mentoring with Lojhan was simply different from anything I had ever experienced. 
He has a gentle, calm manner that makes everything lighter — but at the same time super sharp and provocative (in a good way). During our conversations, he made me think about several points that I had never stopped to reflect on. We went from recommending reading material to sincere exchanges of experiences — where we got it right, where we got it wrong, what we learned from it. 
When I had technical questions, he never gave me the answer straight away. Instead, he encouraged me to experiment, to use a new tool, to get out of my comfort zone. Without a doubt, during the time he mentored me, I took a huge leap in my career. It was a real turning point.

items.name: Tiago Rodrigues
items.feedback:
The mentoring with Lojhan came at a time when I was still thinking about the direction of my career: whether to continue delving deeper into the technical area or to move towards a path more focused on technology management.
After a period working as a senior developer, natural doubts began to arise about the next step. Over time, my interest in IT management became clearer, and the mentoring was fundamental in this process of discovery and transition.
The conversations provided direction, broadened my vision of the role of a technical leader, and helped me understand in greater depth the responsibilities of roles such as software architect and tech lead — both from a technical and behavioral perspective. The exchange was even richer because it included real-world application examples, making the learning practical and applicable to everyday life.
I believe that maintaining this type of active mentoring is essential to support professionals who are in transition or seeking growth, especially those who want to position themselves more strategically within technical teams and take on leadership roles.
